author: By Arlene Fleming
title: How To Get a Job at Delta Air Lines
text:
Delta Air Lines Boeing 757. Photo courtesy of Aero Icarus, via Flickr (http://bit.ly/1gBLHtB). Looking to work for Delta Air Lines? The company is hiring for full time, part-time and seasonal work for flight attendants, baggage handlers, pilots, customer service, and other jobs.
There are i nternships and co-ops available for students that offer hands-on experience in flight simulation, engine maintenance, project management, network planning, demand forecasting, research and analysis, to name a few.
Positions are available year-round at the undergraduate level and, during the summer, at the MBA/graduate level. Students enrolled in university Co–op programs earn Co–op credit by alternating between full-time study and full-time Co-op employment.
Delta offers travel privileges after completing 30 days of service to go anywhere Delta flies. It also offers health/wellness, 401(k) plan, education benefits, adoption assistances and employee discounts on products and services.
Learn more about Delta Air Lines here.
Edited by Benet Wilson.
